title: Figma Launches AI-Powered Erase, Isolate, and Expand Tools for Seamless Image Editing

paragraphs.content: Figma introduced three new AI-powered tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—on December 10, 2025, to enable precise image editing directly within Figma Design and Draw.These features integrate into a unified toolbar alongside existing tools like Remove background and Crop, eliminating the need to export images to external apps like Photoshop.Designers can now use an improved lasso tool to select objects, delete them with AI gap-filling, reposition elements while preserving lighting and shadows, or extend images to new formats without distortion.

primarySource.name: Figma Blog
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: techcrunch
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: The tools prioritize common workflows such as background removal, now prominently placed in the toolbar for quick access.Availability is immediate for Full seat users on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled, using a shared credit system.Figma plans broader rollout across its platform in 2026, building on over 150 features released in 2025.

primarySource.name: youtube
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: ux-news
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

sections.title: Unified Toolbar Streamlines Object Selection and Manipulation

paragraphs.content: The new toolbar consolidates image editing functions, including object selection, background color changes, annotations, and an updated Crop tool with presets like 1:1 and 16:9.Erase object allows users to lasso and remove elements, with AI intelligently filling the space to match surrounding details like color and texture.Isolate object extracts subjects for repositioning, retaining contextual traits such as shadows, focus, and lighting, adjustable via sidebar controls without prompts.

primarySource.name: figma
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: youtube
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: Expand image extends backgrounds to fit layouts, such as converting square hero shots into web banners or mobile formats.These prompt-free tools complement generative AI like Nano Banana, focusing on granular edits for UI/UX and marketing assets.No-code prototypes in Figma Make further tie into AI photo editing workflows.

primarySource.name: help
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: oreateai
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

sections.title: Competitive Push Against Adobe and Canva in AI Editing Race

paragraphs.content: Figma's update positions it to catch up with rivals like Adobe and Canva, which have offered object removal for years, by emphasizing in-app seamlessness.TechCrunch notes these features save the hassle of exporting and reimporting images, a frequent designer pain point.OreteAI calls it a pivotal moment for UI/UX, praising one-click actions and real-time previews.

primarySource.name: figma
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: oreateai
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: Launched alongside Adobe's ChatGPT integrations, where Figma partnered in October 2025, the tools signal aggressive AI expansion without reported controversies as of January 2026.Analysts anticipate 2026 extensions like video frame removal and API access for batch processing.User reactions on YouTube highlight convenience, with creators noting no more tool-juggling for routine edits.
